GENERAL SURVEY OF BIGGIN HILL
Biggin Hill is a small cummuter town within the London Borough of Bromley and surrounded by London's Green Belt. Most of the housing is owner-occupied but life styles vary a great deal. The population has grown rapidly since 1945. Nearby is Downe Village and the hamlets of Berry's Green, Single Street and Luxted. Much of the land in the area used to be for farming but large areas are now used for recreation. There are two golf clubs, a scout camp and several stables, an annual air fair is important for tourism. The R.A.F. station made the area famous during the Battle of Britain. Now it is a busy civillian airport with many of the flights being for recreation.
